quest.name: Wolves and Weeds
journal: Ryosen has lost sight of something important.
objectives: Deliver the mugworts to Ryosen's grandson.
Deliver the waterweed to Ryosen's grandson.

dialogue.name: RYOSEN
dialogue.text: I have lost my grandchild! Please, help me search for him.

dialogue.name: RYOSEN
dialogue.text: He was right next to me until a short while ago. I cannot believe I lost sight of him so easily.

dialogue.name: RYOSEN
dialogue.text: He was asking a lot of questions about the One River; perhaps he went there searching for something.

dialogue.name: RYOSEN
dialogue.text: Though, I truly hope that is not the case. I have heard that a group of Lupin looters roam the area of late. Please search along the One River for my grandson. I shall continue to look for him here.

dialogue.name: RYOSEN
dialogue.text: Please search for my grandson by the One River. I shall continue to look for him here.

dialogue.name: BOY02733
dialogue.text: Grandfather is looking for me, you say? But I cannot go back just yet! I am still searching for that which was taken from me.

dialogue.name: BOY02733
dialogue.text: I was minding my own business, gathering mugworts, when some nasty Lupin stole them right out of my hands!

dialogue.name: BOY02733
dialogue.text: Would you ask the Lupin if they would give me back my plants? You'll find them on the other side of the river.

dialogue.name: BOY02733
dialogue.text: Would you ask the Lupin if they would give me back my plants? You'll find them on the other side of the river.

dialogue.name: RYOSEN
dialogue.text: Where could he have gone to? Oh, I do hope he is safe...

dialogue.name: WEREWOLF02733
dialogue.text: You would have us return some insignificant child's mugworts? Do not make me laugh.

dialogue.name: WEREWOLF02733
dialogue.text: This whole area belongs to us, including any plants that may happen to be plucked by a child of man.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You are under attack!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: You shall regret this!

dialogue.name: BOY02733
dialogue.text: I wonder if the Lupin will give back my plants...

dialogue.name: BOY02733
dialogue.text: Did you get them to return my mugworts?

dialogue.name: BOY02733
dialogue.text: Oh, thank you so much!

dialogue.name: BOY02733
dialogue.text: I was trying to collect plants to make some medicine. I read about it in one of my grandfather's botanicy books! There are so many sick people in the village. I just wanted to help.

dialogue.name: BOY02733
dialogue.text: There is one more thing I need for the medicine: waterweed. I tried to fish some out of the river earlier with a pole. But I didn't have much luck. Could you get some for me?

dialogue.name: BOY02733
dialogue.text: There is one more thing I need for the medicine: waterweed. It's found at the bottom of rivers. Could you get some for me?

dialogue.name: BOY02733
dialogue.text: Did you get some waterweed?

dialogue.name: BOY02733
dialogue.text: Yay! Now I have everything I need!

dialogue.name: BOY02733
dialogue.text: I'll go back to Grandfather now. Thanks for your help!

dialogue.name: RYOSEN
dialogue.text: My grandson is at last returned! He told me all about how you helped him gather the ingredients he needed to make medicine.

dialogue.name: RYOSEN
dialogue.text: While I am glad he has grown to be a kind-hearted boy, there is still much he need learn about discipline and manners.

dialogue.name: RYOSEN
dialogue.text: However, those Lupin should really know better than to steal from a mere child. Their race was once famed for being loyal vassals to some of Doma's mightiest warlords.

dialogue.name: RYOSEN
dialogue.text: When Doma was crushed by the Empire some of them managed to escape, choosing to live as bandits.

dialogue.name: RYOSEN
dialogue.text: It pains me to see a race once so proud fall so low. Something else we have Garlemald to thank for, I suppose.
